Smashing Magazine on Balancing Line Length And Font Size In Responsive Web Design:

65 characters (2.5 times the Roman alphabet) is often referred to as the perfect measure. Derived from this number is the ideal range that all designers should strive for: 45 to 75 characters (including spaces and punctuation) per line for print. Many web designers (including me) apply that rule directly to the web. Iâ€™ve found, however, that we can reliably broaden the range to 45 to 85 characters (including spaces and punctuation) per line for web pages.

…

While there is no perfect line height, a good rule of thumb is to set it at approximately 150% of the font size.

I prefer not to go over 80 characters. Other than that I like these suggestions.
